title: Effigy Mounds National Monument: Plants
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Plants               Plants         Goat prairie overlooking Mississippi River Valley   The monument is in a transition zone of several vegetation communities. The monument was created from the acquisition of private land that had been farmed and logged altering the native vegetation mosaic. Results of monument vegetation surveys combined with information from federal land surveys show that a mosaic of forest, savanna, and prairie covered the monument. Prairie and savanna dominated ridges and south facing slopes. Forests pockets were likely found on north facing slopes and in the river floodplain.
